Sentiments.Phrase: to see my wife. She's buried in the cemetery near there. You know, we got married fifty years ago on this very day. Let me tell you, that night
my wife was beaming. Folks were generous,
and we left richer than we'd every been!

Hints: I need to place the old man at the speakeasy.
I need to pin the alcohol sale on the old man.
Let's make sure he ends up with the cash.
Let's cut out the part about his wife.
FailureMessages: No, no! I need to try again.
This won't hold up in court!
I need to try again. It's not quite right.
I don't think the jury will buy this...
EmptyFailureMessage: I have to record something. The jury will want to see some evidence...
